		<section class="wpb-content-wrapper"><div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1424282160998 vc_row-has-fill"><div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12"><div class="vc_column-inner"><div class="wpb_wrapper">			
			<h2 class="vc-module content-headline" style="color: #ffffff; text-align: center;">
				CIMA's Mission Statement			</h2>

			
		<div class="vc-module text-area" style="color: #ffffff !important; text-align: center !important;">
			<p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><span style="color: #ffffff;">The Center for International Media Assistance (CIMA) is dedicated to improving efforts to promote independent media in emerging democracies and developing economies around the world.</span></p>

		</div>

		</div></div></div></div><div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1428597489836 vc_row-has-fill"><div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill"><div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1428597504662"><div class="wpb_wrapper">			
			<div class="section-title mod">
				<span>Find Out</span>
				<h4>About CIMA</h4>
							</div>

			
		<div class="vc-module text-area" style="color: #999999 !important; text-align: left !important;">
			<p><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_R_pb_leUhE?rel=0&controls=0&showinfo=0" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><p>We strive to build a foundation of knowledge for media development donors, implementers, and civil society actors on best practices and solutions for improving media systems. We do this because we believe media plays an indispensable role in the creation and development of sustainable democracies.</p>
<p>CIMA focuses on four cross-cutting issue areas in media development: effectiveness, sustainability, innovation, and funding. Together, they encompass efforts to improve the capacity and quality of the media sector.</p><p><strong>What we do:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Conduct Research</li>
<li>Produce Written Analysis</li>
<li>Convene Experts</li>
<li>Develop Networks of Thought Leaders</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>What is Media Development?</strong></p>
<p>The term media development refers to evolution and change in the fields of news media and communications. Such change relates to a range of institutions, practices, and behaviors including the rule of law, freedoms of expression and press, education systems for journalists, business environments, capacities of journalists and managers, as well as support for a diversity of views in society. This evolution can be stimulated by donor support, private investment, or local processes of change led by media owners, managers, journalists, media industry associations, and other collective efforts. <a href="http://www.cima.ned.org/what-is-media-development/">Read more!</a></p>
		</div>

		</div></div></div><div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-6 vc_col-has-fill"><div class="vc_column-inner vc_custom_1428011299374"><div class="wpb_wrapper">							<div class="vc-module lower-caption-slider">
					<div class="slide-rack">
													<div class="slide-container">
								<div class="slide active" style="background-image: url('https://www.cima.ned.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/news-on-smartphone_1866430684.jpg');">
									<a href="https://www.cima.ned.org/publication/making-big-tech-pay-for-the-news-they-use/"><button type="button"><i class="fa fa-2x fa-long-arrow-right"></i></button></a>
								</div>
								<div class="lower-caption-box">
									<h3>Making Big Tech Pay for the News They Use</h3>
									<p><p>As policymakers around the world consider how to rebalance the relationship between Big Tech and the news industry, it is imperative that they take a global view and consider the implications for independent news outlets in developing and low-income countries. </p>
</p>
								</div>
							</div>
													<div class="slide-container">
								<div class="slide " style="background-image: url('https://www.cima.ned.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/iStock-639646818.jpg');">
									<a href="https://www.cima.ned.org/publication/private-gatekeepers-encrypted-messaging-apps-and-news-audiences/"><button type="button"><i class="fa fa-2x fa-long-arrow-right"></i></button></a>
								</div>
								<div class="lower-caption-box">
									<h3>Private Gatekeepers: Encrypted Messaging Apps and News Audiences</h3>
									<p><p>Widespread use of encrypted messaging apps (EMAs) in developing countries and emerging democracies has prompted news outlets in these regions to experiment with them as mechanisms for distributing the news.</p>
</p>
								</div>
							</div>
													<div class="slide-container">
								<div class="slide " style="background-image: url('https://www.cima.ned.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/RM_Alamy_2F293EF_Phillipines-protest_Majority-World-CIC-Alamy-Stock-Photo.jpg');">
									<a href="https://www.cima.ned.org/publication/tipping-point-democratic-erosion-and-the-assault-on-press-freedom/"><button type="button"><i class="fa fa-2x fa-long-arrow-right"></i></button></a>
								</div>
								<div class="lower-caption-box">
									<h3>Tipping Point: Democratic Erosion and the Assault on Press Freedom</h3>
									<p><p>The majority of people now live under illiberal regimes or some form of autocracy as a consequence of democratic declines occurring globally since 2010. Understanding the driving forces behind this historic setback to democratic progress will be essential for turning the tide. An analysis of media indicators in the Varieties of Democracy Institute’s global index illustrates a common pattern in countries experiencing democratic setbacks, with important implications for action.</p>
</p>
								</div>
							</div>
													<div class="slide-container">
								<div class="slide " style="background-image: url('https://www.cima.ned.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/4934743466_2fccf909e4_3k-scaled.jpg');">
									<a href="https://www.cima.ned.org/blog/turning-the-tide-on-autocrats-starts-with-supporting-a-free-press/"><button type="button"><i class="fa fa-2x fa-long-arrow-right"></i></button></a>
								</div>
								<div class="lower-caption-box">
									<h3>Turning the Tide on Autocrats Starts with Supporting a Free Press</h3>
									<p><p>At a moment of existential threat to independent media in many countries, the award of the Nobel Peace Prize to two of the world’s bravest and most committed journalists—Maria Ressa of Rappler, and Dmitry Muratov of Novaya Gazeta—sends an important message. For the sake of democratic societies, a free press and access to trustworthy information must remain sacred.</p>
</p>
								</div>
							</div>
													<div class="slide-container">
								<div class="slide " style="background-image: url('https://www.cima.ned.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/mobile-phone-security-concept_iStock-1263285756.jpg');">
									<a href="https://www.cima.ned.org/publication/spyware-an-unregulated-and-escalating-threat-to-independent-media/"><button type="button"><i class="fa fa-2x fa-long-arrow-right"></i></button></a>
								</div>
								<div class="lower-caption-box">
									<h3>Spyware: An Unregulated and Escalating Threat to Independent Media</h3>
									<p><p> The use of spyware poses safety risks to journalists and their sources, encourages self-censorship, and creates new financial and operational strains for news outlets. Media advocates, news outlets, and policymakers must articulate the irreparable harm spyware poses to independent media in order to develop a robust response.</p>
</p>
								</div>
							</div>
											</div>
					<div class="slider-controls">
													<div class="slide-trigger active" style="width: 20%;"></div>
													<div class="slide-trigger " style="width: 20%;"></div>
													<div class="slide-trigger " style="width: 20%;"></div>
													<div class="slide-trigger " style="width: 20%;"></div>
													<div class="slide-trigger " style="width: 20%;"></div>
											</div>
				</div>

readabilityObject.title: Center for International Media Assistance - About
readabilityObject.content:
We strive to build a foundation of knowledge for media development donors, implementers, and civil society actors on best practices and solutions for improving media systems. We do this because we believe media plays an indispensable role in the creation and development of sustainable democracies.

CIMA focuses on four cross-cutting issue areas in media development: effectiveness, sustainability, innovation, and funding. Together, they encompass efforts to improve the capacity and quality of the media sector.

What we do:

  • Conduct Research
  • Produce Written Analysis
  • Convene Experts
  • Develop Networks of Thought Leaders

What is Media Development?

The term media development refers to evolution and change in the fields of news media and communications. Such change relates to a range of institutions, practices, and behaviors including the rule of law, freedoms of expression and press, education systems for journalists, business environments, capacities of journalists and managers, as well as support for a diversity of views in society. This evolution can be stimulated by donor support, private investment, or local processes of change led by media owners, managers, journalists, media industry associations, and other collective efforts. Read more!
